body:
If I try to compile c-toxcore on archlinux I get the following warnings from namcap:

```
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/bin/DHT_bootstrap')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libm.so.6' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxcore.so.0.0.0')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libm.so.6' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxdns.so.0.0.0')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/librt.so.1' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxdns.so.0.0.0')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxdns.so.0.0.0')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libm.so.6' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxencryptsave.so.0.0.0')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/librt.so.1' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxencryptsave.so.0.0.0')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxencryptsave.so.0.0.0')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/librt.so.1' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxav.so.0.0.0')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libsodium.so.18' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxav.so.0.0.0')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libm.so.6' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxav.so.0.0.0')
```

The libpthread one can be ignored, but the rest can possibly fixed.

comment_data.body: Did you build it using autotools or cmake? It looks like autotools. Can you try building with cmake and see which warnings you get?

Looks like autotools to me:
https://git.archlinux.org/svntogit/community.git/tree/trunk/PKGBUILD?h=packages/toxcore

cc @farseerfc

With a modified PKGBUILD the warning disappeared. However the test fails ( @farseerfc is that normal/critical?) as no make check seems to be available
```
==> Starting check()...
make: *** No rule to make target 'check'.  Stop.
```

```
Checking toxcore-1:0.1.2-2-x86_64.pkg.tar.xz
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxcrypto.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxfriends.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxmessenger.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxgroup.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxcore.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxdns.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxencryptsave.so')
```

PKGBUILD:
```bash
build() {
  cd $_pkgname-$pkgver
  mkdir -p build
  cd build
  cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr ..
  # autoreconf -if
  # ./configure \
  #   --prefix=/usr \
  #   --enable-daemon \
  #   --disable-ntox \
  #   --enable-tests
  make
}

```
@NicoHood we might need to pass arguments to cmake to specifically enable tests, as we did with autoconf. I will try rebuild c-toxcore with cmake.

I just find out with cmake, the tests will be automatically enabled when `check` is installed. And we have to use `make test` instead of `make check` for cmake generated Makefile.

I have successfully passed `make test`, but there are still some warnings from namcap:
```
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxcrypto.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxfriends.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxmessenger.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxgroup.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxcore.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxdns.so')
toxcore W: Unused shared library '/usr/lib/libpthread.so.0' by file ('usr/lib/libtoxencryptsave.so')
```

The full build log is here: https://cfp.vim-cn.com/cbcNr
Ok, this will be resolved when we get to fix #14. In the meantime, pthread will be linked unnecessarily. I'm happy if it's only pthread.

Thanks for the explanation. 
A following question, with autotools I get so files with soname like:
```
toxcore /usr/lib/libtoxcore.so
toxcore /usr/lib/libtoxcore.so.0
toxcore /usr/lib/libtoxcore.so.0.0.0
```
but with cmake, only so file is generated:
```
toxcore /usr/lib/libtoxcore.so
```
Is this expected?

I am asking this because all other tox clients (toxic, qtox, tuntox) seems to linked against soname file currently. I will need to rebuild all of them if I switch to cmake.

Can't comment on cmake, but just to clarify: autotools uses the libtool versioning scheme, i.e.: .so.X.X.X where the X numbers provide information on ABI compatibility between different library versions.

I do not know if something like that exists for cmake, but imho it's a good thing to have.

> but with cmake, only so file is generated:

CMake needs to be configured for this:

> https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/install.html
>  See the VERSION and SOVERSION target properties for details on creating versioned shared libraries.

> https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/prop_tgt/SOVERSION.html#prop_tgt:SOVERSION
Sent a PR to add it: #394
@cebe after accepting your invitation, please assign this issue to yourself.
Also, close it once you've submitted the PR.
@iphydf My PR is not about the original issue but about this comment: https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/issues/359#issuecomment-270710463
@jin-eld are you interested in fixing this on the autotools side?
@iphydf OK I'll have a look
@NicoHood does this still happen? We've added shared library versioning by now and redone some of the build system.
@farseerfc Should be able to answer that, he is maintaining the toxcore for archlinux. Could you please help?

@iphydf Currently on Arch Linux we are using cmake to make c-toxcore.
The symbol links are correctly generated:
```
toxcore /usr/lib/libtoxcore.so
toxcore /usr/lib/libtoxcore.so.1
toxcore /usr/lib/libtoxcore.so.1.11.0
```

So I think this issue is now fixed.

@farseerfc I tried to rebuild toxcore myself but some tests failed. Those must have been working when you compiled toxcore. Since I am building in a chroot it must work idential. Any ideas what is wrong?
```
70% tests passed, 6 tests failed out of 20

Total Test time (real) = 460.57 sec

The following tests FAILED:
	  3 - conference (Failed)
	  4 - crypto (Failed)
	  8 - network (Failed)
	 13 - tox (Failed)
	 14 - tox_many (Failed)
	 15 - tox_many_tcp (Failed)
Errors while running CTest
make: *** [Makefile:95: test] Error 8
```

@NicoHood Yes, tests fail (randomly?) on my machines too. I suspect the result depends on the network environment. Running the exact same PKGBUILD with `extra-x86_64-build` again and again will eventually success. My experience is that putting the machine into an idle state with no extra network programs will increase the possibility of success.
This problem may belong to a new issue.
Reopen if this is still an issue.

title: Unused shared libraries
